bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 23 (Monday, February 8, 2021)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. GRIFFITH:H.R. 932.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:This bill is enacted pursuant to the power granted toCongress under Article I, Section 8 of the United StatesConstitution.[Page H483]

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Conservation and Forestry.
Referred to the House Committee on Agriculture.

item.name: Social work, volunteer service, charitable organizations

summary.text:
This bill directs the Forest Service to report on, with respect to each National Forest

  • the amount of volunteer hours served,
  • the deferred maintenance backlog,
  • whether volunteers could carry out any projects under the deferred maintenance backlog, and
  • any barriers to increasing volunteer participation.

bill.title: To require the Secretary of Agriculture to conduct a study on national forest volunteers, and for other purposes.

item.title: To require the Secretary of Agriculture to conduct a study on national forest volunteers, and for other purposes.
To require the Secretary of Agriculture to conduct a study on national forest volunteers, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Conservation and Forestry.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
